alert.note: Alert for Whatcom (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 3:43AM PST until January 30 at 6:16AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County. .The Nooksack River at Ferndale continues to rise and will crest this afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nooksack River at Ferndale. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, the river begins overtopping its banks within the City of Ferndale flooding low-lying areas within the City and low pasture lands along the river from near Ferndale downstream to the mouth. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM PST Monday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM PST Monday was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 18.5 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.4 feet on 01/09/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1145 AM PST.
